purchase.title: Season Ticket Holder Buyout
purchase.sellerProfile: Lions season ticket holder looking to liquidate giveaway items

purchaseAnalysis.notes: Individual item prices were negotiated as part of the bulk purchase. Total paid was $250.00.

sellerProfile: Attended games for the experience, not the collectibles
Accumulated items passively over multiple seasons as a season ticket holder
Had no emotional attachment to the promotional items
Simply wanted to clear closet space and liquidate quickly
Wasn't a collector, so didn't know or care about maximizing value
strategicAdvantages: Bulk Purchase Leverage: Buying in bulk allowed for better negotiation on per-unit pricing
Seller preferred single transaction over listing items individually
Reduced the seller's time and effort compared to eBay/marketplace sales
Information Asymmetry: Extensive pre-purchase research gave accurate market values
Seller didn't invest time in researching individual item values
Quality Assurance: All items new in box (NIB) - critical for collectible value
Season ticket holder storage ensured proper care
No risk of counterfeit items from original recipient
Portfolio Diversification: Acquired multiple years (2022-2024) in single transaction

transactionDetails.inspection: All items verified as new in box before payment
transactionDetails.negotiation: Started at asking price, negotiated to $250 for bulk purchase

lessonsLearned: Season ticket holders are ideal sellers - They accumulate items naturally but often don't collect them
Bulk purchases create negotiation leverage - Sellers value convenience of single transaction
Research is critical - Knowing true market values enables confident negotiation
NIB condition is non-negotiable - Condition dramatically affects collectible value
80% of market is a strong entry point - Provides margin of safety and profit potential
